intro: Spermacoce gracillima, commonly known as slender starlingweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. Its fruits are small, dry, and three-lobed, containing several seeds. Spermacoce gracillima is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
